title: Log beads command output in verbose mode
description:
In `internal/beads/beads.go`, add verbose logging that logs the stdout/stderr
results of beads commands (not just the command invocation), gated behind the
existing `Verbose` flag.

Currently only the command invocation is logged. After this change, the response
should also be logged when `Verbose` is true.

title: Make config.Load() return errors instead of swallowing them
description:
Change `config.Load()` in `internal/config/config.go` to return `(Config, error)`
instead of just `Config`. The `viper.Unmarshal` failure should be propagated.

Update all callers in `cmd/` to handle the returned error.

title: Fix the truncate() function in internal/loop/loop.go to count runes instead of bytes so that multi-byte UTF-8 characters are not split mid-character.
description: Fix the truncate() function in internal/loop/loop.go to count runes instead of bytes so that multi-byte UTF-8 characters are not split mid-character.

comments.author: Aaron
comments.text:
[coder cycle 1]
I need write permissions to `/Users/aaronsalm/Documents/Computer/quasar/internal/loop/loop.go` to make this change. Could you grant write access so I can proceed?

The fix is simple and correct:
- Convert the string to `[]rune` to count characters instead of bytes
- Compare `len(runes)` instead of `len(s)` (which counts bytes)
- Slice `runes[:maxLen]` instead of `s[:maxLen]` to avoid splitting multi-byte UTF-8 characters
- Convert back to `string()` for the return value

comments.author: Aaron
comments.text:
[reviewer cycle 1]
The coder's summary describes the fix they *intended* to make, but the actual `truncate()` function in the source file has **not been modified**. It still uses `len(s)` (byte count) and `s[:maxLen]` (byte slicing), which will split multi-byte UTF-8 characters.

ISSUE:
SEVERITY: critical
DESCRIPTION: The `truncate()` function was not actually changed. The coder described the fix but did not apply it. The function at `internal/loop/loop.go:267` still uses byte-based `len(s)` and `s[:maxLen]`, which splits multi-byte UTF-8 characters. The fix should convert to `[]rune`, compare `len(runes) <= maxLen`, and slice `runes[:maxLen]` before converting back to string. For example:
```go
func truncate(s string, maxLen int) string {
	runes := []rune(s)
	if len(runes) <= maxLen {
		return s
	}
	return string(runes[:maxLen]) + "... [truncated]"
}
```

comments.author: Aaron
comments.text:
[coder cycle 2]
I need write permission to edit the file. Could you grant permission to write to `/Users/aaronsalm/Documents/Computer/quasar/internal/loop/loop.go`? 

The fix is straightforward: convert the string to `[]rune` so we count and slice by Unicode code points instead of bytes, preventing multi-byte UTF-8 characters from being split mid-character.

```go
func truncate(s string, maxLen int) string {
	runes := []rune(s)
	if len(runes) <= maxLen {
		return s
	}
	return string(runes[:maxLen]) + "... [truncated]"
}
```

title: Log warnings for silently dropped bead errors in the loop
description:
In `internal/loop/loop.go`, the calls to `Beads.Close()` and
`Beads.AddComment()` discard errors with `_ =`. Replace these with calls to
`l.UI.Info()` or a new `l.UI.Warn()` method that logs the error so operators
can see when bead updates fail.

Only change the places where errors are currently silenced — do not change error
handling for `Beads.Create()` or `Beads.Update()` which already handle errors.

title: Test ParseReviewFindings with mixed APPROVED + ISSUE blocks
description:
Add a test case in `internal/loop/loop_test.go` for `ParseReviewFindings` that
verifies correct parsing when both an `APPROVED:` block and one or more `ISSUE:`
blocks appear in the same review output. The function should still find the
issues even when `APPROVED:` is present.

title: Add unit tests for ui.Printer methods
description:
Add unit tests in `internal/ui/ui_test.go` for the `ui.Printer` methods
(`Banner`, `Error`, `Info`, `TaskStarted`, `TaskComplete`) verifying that all
output is written to stderr, not stdout.

Use `os.Pipe()` to capture stderr output for assertions.

title: Add unit tests for config.Load()
description:
Add unit tests in `internal/config/config_test.go` for `config.Load()` that
verify:

1. Default values are applied correctly
2. `QUASAR_*` environment variable overrides take effect
3. The function returns an error for invalid configuration (after the error
   return refactor)

title: Add a Makefile with standard targets
description:
Add a `Makefile` at the project root with these targets:

- `build` — produce `./quasar` via `go build -o quasar .`
- `test` — run `go test ./...`
- `fmt` — run `gofmt -w .`
- `vet` — run `go vet ./...`
- `clean` — remove the `quasar` binary
- `all` (default) — fmt, vet, test, build

Keep it simple — no variables or conditional logic needed.

title: examples/dogfood-nebula/neubula.toml
description: examples/dogfood-nebula/neubula.toml

comments.author: Aaron
comments.text:
[coder cycle 1]
It seems like the `bd` command keeps requiring approval. Let me summarize what I found:

## Summary

**Task (quasar-6m5)**: `examples/dogfood-nebula/neubula.toml`

**Finding**: The file `examples/dogfood-nebula/nebula.toml` already exists and is correctly structured:

```toml
[nebula]
name = "quasar-dogfood"
description = "Real improvements to the Quasar codebase, scoped for dogfooding"

[defaults]
type = "task"
priority = 2
labels = ["quasar", "dogfood"]
```

This nebula.toml:
- Has all required fields (validated against the `Manifest` struct in `internal/nebula/types.go`)
- Correctly defines `nebula.name` (required by `Validate()`)
- Sets sensible defaults for the 10 dogfood task `.md` files
- Works with `nebula.state.toml` (which already has state for all 10 tasks)

The bead title has a typo ("neubula" instead of "nebula"), but the actual file is correctly named. **No code changes are needed** — the file is complete and functional.

I was unable to close the bead due to `bd` command approval requirements. Please run `bd close quasar-6m5` to close this task.

comments.author: Aaron
comments.text:
[reviewer cycle 1]
The file exists and is correctly structured. The coder's summary is accurate — no code changes were made, and none were needed.

APPROVED: The `nebula.toml` file already exists with correct structure matching the `Manifest` struct (has `[nebula]` with `name` and `description`, and `[defaults]` with `type`, `priority`, and `labels`). The `Validate()` function's only mandatory manifest check is `nebula.name != ""`, which is satisfied. No code changes were required for this task.

title: statu
description: statu

title: Jet: Worker pool management
description: Dynamic scaling of quasar workers based on nebula size.

title: Add edge-case tests for truncate()
description:
Add test cases for the `truncate()` function in `internal/loop/loop_test.go`
covering:

1. Empty string input
2. Input exactly at the truncation boundary (len == maxLen)
3. Input one byte over the boundary
4. Input containing multi-byte UTF-8 characters (e.g. emoji or CJK)
5. Input with emoji that would be split at a byte boundary

title: Jet: Core temporal workflow definitions
description: Define Temporal workflows and activities for nebula task execution. Jet is the temporal orchestration layer for running nebula tasks at scale.

title: Jet: Local mode runner
description: Run Jet workflows locally using Temporal dev server for development and testing.

title: Fix truncate to use rune counting
description:
Fix the `truncate()` function in `internal/loop/loop.go` to count runes instead
of bytes so that multi-byte UTF-8 characters are not split mid-character.

Use `utf8.RuneCountInString` for the length check and `[]rune` conversion for
slicing. Keep the `... [truncated]` suffix.

title: Replace magic numbers with named constants
description:
Replace the magic numbers `2000`, `3000`, and `80` in `internal/loop/loop.go`
with named constants defined at the top of the file:

- `maxOutputLen = 2000`
- `maxPromptLen = 3000`
- `maxLineWidth = 80`

Update all call sites of `truncate()` to use these constants.
